Home About Blog

Technology-Hub

  • HTML5 & CSS3

    HTML (the Hypertext Markup Language) and CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) are two of the core technologies for building Web pages.

  • JavaScript

    JavaScript is a lightweight, interpreted programming language. It is designed for creating network-centric applications.

  • NodeJS

    As an asynchronous event driven JavaScript runtime, NodeJS is designed to build scalable network applications.

  • NuxtJS

    Its main scope is UI rendering while abstracting away the client/server distribution.

  • PHP

    PHP, which stands for “PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor” is a widely-used Open Source general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for web development and can be embedded into HTML.

  • VueJS

    Vue (pronounced /vjuː/, like view) is a progressive framework for building user interfaces.
